t: A Lament over the Destruction of Jerusalem, and Prayer for Help.
O*pn God, the nations have invaded Your inheritance; They*ln have defiled Your holy temple; They*ln have laid Jerusalem in ruins.
They*ln have given the dead bodies of Your servants for food to the birds of the heavens, The*ln flesh of Your godly ones to the beasts of the earth.
They*ln have poured out their blood like water round about Jerusalem; And*ln there was no one to bury them.
We*ln have become a reproach to our neighbors, A*ln scoffing and derision to those around us.
How*ln long, O Lord?*s Will You be angry forever? Will*ln Your jealousy burn like fire?
Pour*ln out Your wrath upon the nations which do not know You, And*ln upon the kingdoms which do not call upon Your name.
For*ln they have devoured Jacob And*ln laid waste his habitation.
Do*ln not remember the iniquities of our*i forefathers against us; Let*ln Your compassion come quickly to meet us, For*ln we are brought very low.
Help*ln us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name; And*ln deliver us and forgive our sins for Your name’s sake.
Why*ln should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let*ln there be known among the nations in our sight, Vengeance*ln for the blood of Your servants which has been shed.
Let*ln the groaning of the prisoner come before You; According*ln to the greatness of Your power preserve those who are doomed to die.
And*ln return to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom The*ln reproach with which they have reproached You, O Lord.
So*ln we Your people and the sheep of Your pasture Will*ln give thanks to You forever; To*ln all generations we will tell of Your praise.
